June 17, 1979: Fiction
THE MATARESE CIRCLE, by Robert Ludlum. (Richard Marek, $12.50.) The top
American and Soviet agents save Western civilization.
GOOD AS GOLD, by Joseph Heller. (Simon & Schuster, $12.95.) The ambitions
and agonies of some American Jews.
THE THIRD WORLD WAR: August 1985, by General Sir John Hackett and Other
Top-ranking NATO Generals and Advisors. (Macmillian, $12.95.) A history of the
global war to come.
SHIBUMI, by Trevanian. (Crown, $10.95.) Nicholai Hel, professional assassin,
takes on an international terror organization.
WAR AND REMEMBRANCE, by Herman Wouk. (Little, Brown, $15.) The Henry
family of "The Winds of War" during World War II.
HANTA YO, by Ruth Beebe Hill. (Doubleday, $14.95.) Multigenerational saga of
American Indian culture.
CHESAPEAKE, by James A. Michener. (Random House, $12.95.) Four centuries
of Maryland's Eastern Shore.
THE VICAR OF CHRIST, by Walter F. Murphy. (Macmillian, $12.95.) The first
American pope.
SS-GB, by Len Deighton. (Knopf, $9.95.) Nazi-occupied Britain in 1941.
GHOST STORY, by Peter Straub. (Coward, McCann & Geogheghan, $10.95.) An
eerie tale of psychic possession and supernatural doings in contemporary
America.
CLASS REUNION, by Rona Jaffe. (Delacorte, $9.95.) Four Radcliffe girls in the
1950's, and what happens to them between graduation and their 20th reunion.
THE PIGEON PROJECT, by Irving Wallace. (Simon & Schuster, $10.95.) A British
scientist discovers a substance in Soviet Georgia that prolongs life.
THE ISLAND, by Peter Benchley. (Doubleday, $8.95.) A journalist undertakes to
solve a "Bermuda triangle" style mystery.
A NECESSARY WOMAN, by Helen Van Slyke. (Doubleday, $10.95.) A South
Pacific cruise and a woman's time of quiet decisions.
THE STORIES OF JOHN CHEEVER, by John Cheever. (Knopf, $15.) Visions of
lost moral order amid contemporary domestic disarray.
Non-Fiction
THE COMPLETE SCARSDALE MEDICAL DIET, by Herman Tarnower, M.D. and
Samm Sinclair Baker. (Rawson, Wade, $7.95.) A plan to lose up to 20 pounds in
14 days.
THE BRONX ZOO, by Sparky Lyle and Peter Golenbock. (Crown, $8.95.) A
behind-the-scenes look at the temperamental Yankees by their former star
reliever.
THE POWERS THAT BE, by David Halberstam. (Knopf, $15.) Four news empires
-- The Los Angeles Times, The Washington Post, Time Inc, and CBS.
HOW TO PROSPER DURING THE COMING BAD YEARS, by Howard J. Ruff.
(Times Books, $8.95.) Personal investment guide.
THE PRITIKIN PROGRAM, by Nathan Pritikin with Patrick M. McGrady, Jr.
(Grosset & Dunlap, $12.95.) A prescription for health and long life.
LAUREN BACALL BY MYSELF, by Lauren Bacall. (Knopf, $10.95.) Memories of
life with and without Bogart.
TO SET THE RECORD STRAIGHT, by John J. Sirica. (Norton, $15.) The Federal
judge who presided at the Watergate trial reconsiders the case.
CRUEL SHOES, by Steve Martin. (Putnam's, $8.95.) Zany satire by a young
television comedian.
THE COMPLETE BOOK OF RUNNING, by James F. Fixx. (Random House, $10.)
For fun and health.
THE MEDUSA AND THE SNAIL, by Lewis Thomas.  (Viking, $8.95.) Essays by a
biology watcher.
BEYOND REASON, by Margaret Trudeau. (Paddington, $10.95.) Pierre Trudeau's
wife tells her own story.
A DISTANT MIRROR, by Barbara W. Tuchman. (Knopf, $15.95.) The calamitous
14th century.
MOMMIE DEAREST, by Christina Crawford. (Morrow, $9.95.) Life with Joan
Crawford.
HOW TO GET WHATEVER YOU WANT OUT OF LIFE, by Dr. Joyce Brothers.
(Simon & Schuster, $8.95.) Advice on how to succeed in life by a well-known
psychologist.
SOPHIA, LIVING AND LOVING, by A.E. Hotchner. (Morrow, $9.95.) Sophia Loren
tells her life story.
